intro: Tubella notosibirica, commonly known as the Siberian bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the cold climates of Siberia and northern regions of Russia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family, which includes bellflowers and related species. The plant features showy, bell-shaped blue or violet flowers that bloom in late summer. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Tubella notosibirica is valued for its ornamental appeal and its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
